backend

Class LocationAdder

  • java.lang.Object
    • databaseConnectors.DatabaseManager
      • backend.LocationAdder

  • public class LocationAdder
extends DatabaseManager
    When a new locations is being added trough the CSV-file this class is used to add both the location and a new athlete if the athlete does not already exist. If the athlete exists in database, only a new locatio will be added.

    • Method Detail

      • addLocations

        public void addLocations(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String[]> csvList)
        Adds locations to athletes in the database, with from and to dates. If the athlete does not exist, a new athlete is created. This is only based on the athlete's name. Meaning to athletes with identical names can not exist in the system. New athletes will only be added with full names. The rest must be manually inserted by a user. If the location of the athlete does not already exist in the database, a new location will be created and added to the database. The height of the location will be found added to the database using the name of the location only. If the name of the location is not found in the Google Maps, the location will still be added, but the height will be set to 0 meters.
        Parameters:
        csvList - An ArrayList containing String[] that contains cells from the CSV-files.

      • addLocation

        private void addLocation(java.lang.String[] csvLine,
                         int athleteID)
        Adds a new location to an athlete with from date, and to date into the database. If the athlete already has a location at the in the database, with the same from date and to date, a new location will not be added. If the location does not already exist in the database, it will be inserted together with its altitude into the database. If the location is not found in Google Maps, the location will still be added, but the altitude will be set to 0 meters.
        Parameters:
        csvLine - a line from a CSV-file (firstName, lastName, location, fromDate, toDate)
        athleteID - athleteID of the athlete you want to add new locations to.

      • getAthleteID

        private int getAthleteID(java.lang.String firstname,
                         java.lang.String lastname)
        Gets the athleteID of an athlete based on his/her first name and last name. Returns 0 if the athlete does not already exist in the database.
        Parameters:
        firstname - first name of the athlete
        lastname - last name of the athlete
        Returns:
        int the athlete's athleteID

      • locationExists

        private boolean locationExists(java.lang.String location)
        Checks the database if a location exist based on the locations name. If a location exists, it will return true, if not it will return false.
        Parameters:
        location - a String with the name of the location on the from (Country, City, Adrdess, etc.)
        Returns:
        boolean true if exists, false if not

      • athleteExists

        private boolean athleteExists(java.lang.String firstname,
                              java.lang.String lastname)
        Checks the databse if an athlete exists based on the athletes first and last name. if an athlete exist it will return true, if not it will return false.
        Parameters:
        firstname - first name of the athlete
        lastname - last name of the athlete
        Returns:
        boolean true if exist, false if not

      • makeSQLDate

        private java.sql.Date makeSQLDate(java.lang.String dateString)
        Creates a java.sql.Date Object from a String on the format "yyyy-MM-dd". Returns null if the date String is in the wrong format.
        Parameters:
        dateString - String date on the format "yyyy-MM-dd".
        Returns:
        java.sql.Date

      • locationOverlaps

        private boolean locationOverlaps(int athleteID,
                                 java.lang.String newFromDate,
                                 java.lang.String newToDate)
        Checks if a from date and a to date, already has been added to the athlete's locations. if so, it will return true, if not it will return false.
        Parameters:
        athleteID - athleteID of the athlete you want to check for
        newFromDate - newFromDate that you want to check for
        newToDate - newToDate that you want to check for
        Returns:
        boolean true if they already exist in the database, false if not
